questions.question: Which tab in MS Word contains the 'Page Setup' group?
questions.explanation: The Layout tab (sometimes called Page Layout) houses commands for Margins, Orientation, Size, and Columns.

questions.question: You want your document to be wider than it is tall (horizontal). Which Orientation should you select?
questions.explanation: Landscape orientation prints the document horizontally, making it wider than it is tall.

questions.question: What does the 'Margins' option control in a Word document?
options: The empty space around the edges of the page
questions.explanation: Margins define the blank borders around the content area (Top, Bottom, Left, Right).

questions.question: HeyGen is an AI platform primarily used for:
questions.explanation: HeyGen allows users to create professional videos using AI avatars and voice synthesis from text.

questions.question: In the Paragraph group of the Layout tab, what does 'Spacing After' do?
options: Adds extra space below the selected paragraph
questions.explanation: Spacing After adds a defined amount of points (pt) of empty space immediately following the selected paragraph.

questions.question: Which tool in the 'Arrange' group allows you to control how text flows around an image?
questions.explanation: Wrap Text determines if text sits above, behind, around, or through an image or object.

questions.question: NotebookLM is an AI tool designed for:
options: Research and note-taking by analyzing uploaded documents
questions.explanation: NotebookLM is an AI-powered research assistant that can summarize and answer questions based on your specific notes and documents.

questions.question: When designing a coupon, which standard paper size is most commonly used for the main document before cutting?
questions.explanation: While coupons are small, they are usually designed multiple per page on a standard A4 or Letter sheet and then cut.

questions.question: You have inserted a shape, but it is covering your text. Which command sends the shape behind the text?
questions.explanation: Sending an object 'Behind Text' places it in the background layer so text appears on top of it.

questions.question: Which feature allows you to split text into two or more vertical blocks, often used in newsletters?
questions.explanation: The Columns feature divides the text on a page into multiple vertical columns.

questions.question: What is the function of the 'Selection Pane' in the Arrange group?
options: To see a list of all objects (shapes, images) and manage their visibility/order
questions.explanation: The Selection Pane lists all graphical objects on the page, allowing you to hide, show, or reorder them easily.

questions.question: If you want to move a paragraph 1 inch away from the left margin, which setting should you change?
questions.explanation: Increasing the Left Indent pushes the paragraph inward from the left margin.

questions.question: What is a 'Coupon' primarily used for?
options: To offer a discount or promotion to customers
questions.explanation: A coupon is a ticket or document that can be redeemed for a financial discount or rebate when purchasing a product.

questions.question: Which option allows you to rotate an image or shape?
questions.explanation: The Rotate command allows you to turn an object 90 degrees or flip it vertically/horizontally.

questions.question: To treat multiple shapes as a single object so they move together, you should use the ______ command.
questions.explanation: Grouping combines selected individual objects into one unit.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a standard page size option in MS Word?
questions.explanation: T-Shirt is not a paper size; A4, Letter, and Legal are standard document sizes.

questions.question: In NotebookLM, how does the AI assist with 'Note-Taking'?
options: It summarizes sources and answers questions based on your uploaded notes
questions.explanation: NotebookLM analyzes the specific documents you upload to generate insights, summaries, and answers.

questions.question: When creating a coupon, why might you use a 'Dashed Line' shape?
options: To indicate where the customer should cut the coupon
questions.explanation: A dashed line is universally recognized as a 'cut here' guide on printed coupons.

questions.question: The 'Align' command in the Arrange group helps you to:
options: Line up objects perfectly (e.g., Align Center, Align Left)
questions.explanation: Alignment tools ensure that selected objects are perfectly positioned relative to the page or each other.

questions.question: What is the benefit of using 'Breaks' (Page Break) from the Layout tab?
options: It forces text to start on the next page immediately
questions.explanation: A Page Break pushes all subsequent text to the top of the next page.
